data.title: A K M Riaz Uddin on LinkedIn: The way we organize our living in modern era needs serious thinking…
data.meta_description: The way we organize our living in modern era needs serious thinking. Planners Architects and all buil environment professionals need to work together to…
data.text:
🌲 🏣 🌳 🏯 🌴 🏭 Brilliant synopsis of why we need to green our cities: - cities are where most of the global population live - extreme temps will kill 5 million people a year - cities are heating up twice as fast as other places - glass concrete steel asphalt absorb heat and radiate it at night solutions: green corridors, trees, shading, water - all help to cool cities

Imagine having a magical shield against the sun's intense rays. ☀️ That's what Sunphade is all about. It intelligently adapts to changes in sunlight, seamlessly transitioning from light to dark and back again, almost like magic ✨ This means you can always enjoy perfect indoor lighting without worrying about glare or heat. It's this dynamic adaptation that makes Sunphade truly unique and magical. Learn more about the magic of Sunphade. 💫 #solarcontrol #solartechnology

As the Arctic Sea ice melts, polar bears are facing starvation as they are unable to adapt their diets to living on land. The iconic Arctic species would normally feed on ringed seals that they catch on ice floors offshore. But as the ice disappears in a warming world, many bears are spending greater amounts of time on shore, eating bird's eggs, berries and grass. Hence, The polar bear has become the poster child for the growing threat of climate change in the Arctic, but the reality of the impact on this species is complicated. #ArcticSea #climatechange #globalimpact Sourced from: https://lnkd.in/gCR5pSus This content is jointly prepared by ripple2wave and ZWEEC Analytics Pte Ltd. Follow us for more interesting content on #water and #sustainability.

https://lnkd.in/gSN22aKs 𝒊𝒏-𝒂-𝒘𝒊𝒏-𝒇𝒐𝒓-𝒕𝒉𝒆-𝒄𝒍𝒊𝒎𝒂𝒕𝒆-𝒖𝒓𝒃𝒂𝒏-𝒔𝒑𝒆𝒆𝒅-𝒍𝒊𝒎𝒊𝒕𝒔-𝒂𝒓𝒆-𝒅𝒓𝒐𝒑𝒑𝒊𝒏𝒈 Not an immediately obvious conclusion. Read the entire article to get the yet another unintended consequence (albeit a significantly positive one). A few interesting nuggets of information as well. A question for auto-enthusiasts: Shouldn't the gearing ratio change to adapt to this new reality? Is it already happening? Or is it unlikely to have a significant impact?

Here is a next excellent YouTube video about the propagation of surges and waves on transmission lines as well as a visualization of the effect of reactive power compensation. Have fun, I am curious to get your comments and opinions. Click on the gif below. https://lnkd.in/dNcKh2_w
